meanings.definition: Not having a stalk or stem.
meanings.sent1: The flower was unstalked, sitting directly on the ground.
meanings.sent2: The unstalked mushroom grew low to the earth.
meanings.sent3: The unstalked tree stump seemed to have lost its way.
meanings.sent4: The unstalked plant stood out in the garden like a rebel.
meanings.sent5: The unstalked daisy looked like it had been forgotten by the gardener.

meanings.definition: Not being followed or observed persistently.
meanings.sent1: Feeling unstalked, she walked confidently through the park.
meanings.sent2: The unstalked deer roamed freely in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The unstalked squirrel played without a care in the world.
meanings.sent4: The unstalked celebrity enjoyed a peaceful day out of the spotlight.
meanings.sent5: The unstalked student finally felt a sense of privacy and relief.
